page.title: 17RECREATION IN SUTTON
page.content: THE JOHN O'GAUNT GOLF CLUB The club was started 37 years ago.The land used to belong to John O'Gaunt,Duke of Lancaster and the site of the first house is called John O'Gaunt's Hill.The present club house was built in 1853.There are 1100 members of which 130 are ladies.Members come from a 30-mile radius of Sutton.Juniors can become members if a parent is a member.There are 18 holes on the course and it is regarded as a top quality course.A new course has been made nearby called The Carthegena.It was necessary to have another as golf has become a very popular sport.There is a Pro-shop where members can buy or hire equipment.
